metadata.title: CVE-2016-9566 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
base/logging.c in Nagios Core before 4.2.4 allows local users with accessto an account in the nagios group to gain root privileges via a symlinkattack on the log file.  NOTE: this can be leveraged by remote attackersusing CVE-2016-9565.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nagios3 - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-cgi - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-common - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-core - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nagios3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1').
